intro: Hieracium hispidulum subsp. hispidulum, commonly known as the hispid hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows, roadsides, and wastelands. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are yellow with ray florets. This subspecies is often found in temperate regions and is relatively common in its native range.
